intro: Galium stenophyllum var. flavoviride, commonly known as the yellow-green bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine, yellow-green hairs, giving the plant its distinctive coloration. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This variant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
